intro: Habenella liguliglossa, commonly known as the narrow-lipped piper, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other species of flowering plants known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and conservation efforts.
